desc: Exchanges a temporary OAuth verifier code for a user access token.

client_id.desc: Issued when you created your application. If possible, avoid sending `client_id` and `client_secret` as parameters in your request and instead supply the Client ID and Client Secret using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme.

client_secret.desc: Issued when you created your application. If possible, avoid sending `client_id` and `client_secret` as parameters in your request and instead supply the Client ID and Client Secret using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme.

code.desc: The `code` param returned via the OAuth callback.

code_verifier.desc: The code_verifier param used to generate the code_challenge originally. Used for PKCE.

redirect_uri.desc: This must match the originally submitted URI (if one was sent).

grant_type.desc: The `grant_type` param as described in the OAuth spec.

refresh_token.desc: The `refresh_token` param as described in the OAuth spec.

output.desc: User access token and app installation information

scope.desc: Comma-separated list of scopes granted to the token.

user_id.desc: The user ID of the user corresponding to the token.

app_id.desc: ID of the app being installed or re-installed.

is_enterprise_install.desc: Boolean flag indicating whether the generated token is enterprise level token or not

expires_in.desc: Time until this credential expires, if it expires at all

id.desc: ID of the team into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

name.desc: Name of the team into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

id.desc: ID of the enterprise into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

name.desc: Name of the enterprise into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

bad_redirect_uri.desc: Value passed for `redirect_uri` did not match the `redirect_uri` in the original request.

cannot_install_an_org_installed_app.desc: Returned when the the org-installed app cannot be installed on a workspace.

invalid_refresh_token.desc: The given refresh token is invalid.

no_user_scopes.desc: Missing user `scope` in the auth request.

oauth_authorization_url_mismatch.desc: The OAuth flow was initiated on an incorrect version of the authorization url. The flow must be initiated via /oauth/v2/authorize .

preview_feature_not_available.desc: Returned when the API method is not yet available on the team in context.

success.description: Successful token request with scopes for a user token.
